$AMZN AWS CEO said ~90% of executives already see positive ROI from AI & called AWS the strongest platform to build agentic AI on.

That‚Äôs because AWS already runs where companies real data & workflows live which lets AI agents take real actions instead of just generating answers.

A reminder that $NVDA is hosting a power summit this week because AI data centers are projected to face a 44 gigawatt power shortfall by 2028.

‚Ä¢ At the top of the stack are the companies that create the power itself like nuclear fuel producers, turbines, backup generators & renewables from names like $CCJ, $LEU, $OKLO, $GEV, $FSLR & $UUUU that produce the raw power inputs the AI buildout depends on.
‚Ä¢ In the middle are the operators like $NEEM $VST, $TLN & $NRG who take those raw inputs & convert them into the dependable electricity that data centers rely on.
‚Ä¢ At the bottom of the stack are the companies that keep the grid stable, including long-duration storage & battery names like $TSLA, $EOSE, $QS, $MVST & $FLNC. 

All three layers now move together because AI data centers can only run at full capacity if fuel supply is secure, generation is steady & the grid can handle the load so if any part of that chain fails then utilization drops & even the strongest GPU demand curves break.

Power has become the real bottleneck of the AI economy & this summit exists because Nvidia knows the next trillion dollars of growth depends on solving it.

Two names that aren‚Äôt included but absolutely should be: 

‚Ä¢ $TSM manufactures the chips the entire AI stack depends on 
‚Ä¢ $PLTR operationalizes AI across governments & enterprises

INSIDE THE $1T AI ECONOMY

‚Ä¢ $NVDA sells the compute every AI system runs on
‚Ä¢ $MSFT packages AI into software & cloud for enterprises
‚Ä¢ $AMZN turns AI demand into sustained cloud & logistics monetization
‚Ä¢ $GOOGL creates AI demand through search & monetizes it through ads & cloud
‚Ä¢ $META uses AI to compound attention & extract more value per ad
‚Ä¢ OpenAI sells intelligence directly as a product
‚Ä¢ $ORCL locks in enterprise AI workloads via OCI
‚Ä¢ $AMD supplies alternative AI compute at scale
‚Ä¢ $AVGO provides the silicon & networking that connects AI systems

$NVDA just took the #1 spot on ClickBench with a GPU-native DuckDB engine.

7.2x better cost efficiency than top CPU systems which shows GPUs moving beyond AI training into core data infrastructure.
Cathie Wood bought ~$17M of $BMNR today

Looks like PayPal wants to rebuild growth by becoming more of a financial infrastructure provider than a pure payments company.

Meta is on track to become one of the largest AI compute platforms in the world thats built on top of the most engaged network ever created. 

It has the audience, the data & the compute to redefine how consumer AI gets built in 2026.

South Korea's Korea Zinc announced a major partnership with the U.S. government to build a state-of-the-art critical minerals smelter and processing facility in Clarksville, Tennessee. Projected to create around 750 high-paying jobs in Tennessee.
$NAVN Navan, Inc. announced the departure of Amy Butte as Chief Financial Officer, effective January 9, 2026, with Anne Giviskos stepping in as Interim CFO.

Rep. Tim Burchett said the U.S. is indirectly sending up to $40M/week into Taliban-controlled Afghanistan, & Dems just blocked bill to stop it.  That money? Straight into the pockets of the same people we spent 20 years and 2,000+ American lives fighting.

Databricks is raising more than $4 billion in a Series L round valuing the firm at $134 billion, a 34% increase from August. 

Databricks said its ARR surpassed $4.8B, up 55% YoY, while both data warehousing and its AI products reached $1B ARR.

Nvidia $NVDA has begun rolling out its Nemotron 3 open models, which it says are the most efficient family of models for building agentic AI apps.

Nemotron 3 Nano is available now, while the larger Super and Ultra models are expected to be available in 1H 2026.
OK we lost open gap SPY so were short as to rules but sweet start on long in the bank trailing to be safe on this give but looking good! Fast charts today!

üì∫ HOW TO TRADE $TSLA AFTER AN EXTENDED MOVE

#Tesla made a strong but isolated move, so this is a spot to lock in gains, lighten up into strength, and then look to re-add on orderly pullbacks‚Äîespecially if it holds the $467 gap area. 

The smart play now is to trade around a core, not chase an extended move. 

We'll see whether #TSLA goes from red to green, which would create strong intraday opportunities.
$spx futures -10 as the market stays weaker.  Watch yesterday‚Äôs low $spy

üì∫ IS THIS THE LAST PULLBACK BEFORE A YEAR-END RALLY?

üåü Get my options ideas: t3live.com/ppo

Tech is weakening, AI leadership is fractured (after $AVGO and $ORCL selloffs), and the Mag 7 $AAPL $AMZN $MSFT $META is being sold for liquidity, even though the indices still look stable on the surface.

$SPY and $QQQ are both sitting on key moving averages, creating a make-or-break spot.

Equal weight $RSP looks healthier, so if a year-end rally shows up, it‚Äôll likely come from broader participation‚Äînot big tech.

Nasdaq is moving to 23hr a day, 5 day a week trading & will file with the SEC on Monday to get it approved

The plan is for a day session from 4am to 8pm ET & a night session from 9pm to 4am, with the trading week running Sunday 9pm to Friday 8pm and a launch targeted for 2H'26

Source: Reuters
